newsitem.title: CROATIA: Prominent British aid official dies in Croatia.
newsitem.headline: Prominent British aid official dies in Croatia.

text.p: Nicholas Hinton, the British founder and director of several international charity and aid groups, died of a heart attack while visiting southern Croatia, his colleagues said on Tuesday.
Hinton's heart failed during a ride with associates from the International Crisis Group (ICG), an independent agency attempting to prevent "man-made" humanitarian disasters.
Hinton was en route to Bosnia, where the ICG has sought to monitor the fragile peace process, said Christopher Bennett, spokesman for ICG in Sarajevo.
"Nicholas Hinton has played an instrumental role in building the International Crisis Group both financially and spiritually," Bennett told Reuters.
The 54-year old Hinton was founder and president of the ICG and was a former director-general of the Save the Children Fund.
Under Hinton's leadership, the ICG had launched projects in Sierra Leone and Bosnia and planned to expand its operations in Africa and open new offices in the Baltics and Latin America.
"We will strive to make his legacy a lasting one," Bennett said.
